str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Of Hebrew origin; a separatist, i.e. Exclusively religious; a Pharisean, i.e. Jewish sectary.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To murmur greatly, continue murmuring. From dia and gogguzo; to complain throughout a crowd.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pros and dechomai; to admit (figuratively) endurance); by implication, to await.
Sinning, sinful, depraved, detestable. From hamartano; sinful, i.e. A sinner.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To eat with. From sun and esthio; to take food in company with.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
